name: Omni Houston Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on a business trip and found this hotel's service absolutely fantastic! Excellent service from the second you walk into the hotel to the second you depart. The service was from door man to front desk was great. This along with the amentities you get as a newly signed up frequent customer is just so much better than EVERY hotel (so far) I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Incredible Service
Sure will come back
reviews.text: Very clean large rooms and nice property. The only and major drawback I had with this hotel is it's location -- it's located in a rather secluded area with little in the immediate walking vicinity so if you don't have a rental car, you're more or less stuck on the property - although the hotel does offer a free shuttle to/from the Galleria Mall.
Overall, a very nice hotel with amazing service.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, few minor issues

reviews.text: I stayed two nights at this hotel. I spent a bit more money for the stay than I first wanted but it was really worth it. I ate at the restaurant Noe and it was really tasty, servants friendly. The room is clean and very modern, has a big tv if you want to spend your time with that. As my computer didn't work I was happy to use their business center; means computer with net which costs you $6.99 per 15 minutes (if I'm not mistaken) and you're able to use the printers. Room service arrived in a good amount of time. The only thing that bothered me was the extra charge for that food and another extra if you don't reach a certain amount of the Room Service....so I paid for a breakfast only containing of pancakes and a glass of orange juice 28 bucks...that was really too much. If you plan to go shopping at the Galleria there is a shuttle: a nice and comfy Lincoln with a driver which lets you feel like a VIP :)
reviews.title: Overall Great Stay at the Omni

reviews.text: I stayed here for a mini vacation in august. Ive stayed here once before a few years ago and it had been updated since then
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel w. Excellent Service

reviews.text: Stayed here for a business trip in September 2007. Had a guaranteed late check in, and almost didn't have room - apparently they had overbooked but a no-show allowed me to have a space.
reviews.title: Solid Service, Nice Stay - Caution on Overbooks

reviews.text: I later heard there were many overbooked guests who didn't get a room - and most other hotels were full. I didn't hear fully how they were accomodated, though there were some reportedly tense conversations for guaranteed rooms.
reviews.title: Needs major improvements

likes.liked: — breakfast was good, but needed to pay for my two children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you get a room, the property is nice. Not great, not bad - just nice. There are nice touches throughout - like champagne upon arrival, a helpful front of house staff, and courteous managers. They have a free town car service within 3 miles of the property - which at times turns into a stretch limo if town cars are booked.
reviews.title: Quite an average hotel

reviews.text: What I think most people respond to is the dated look - there are features that speak to its prominent past - which are ok today though you can tell there haven't been substantial upgrades in a while.
reviews.title: A lovely oasis

likes.liked: — The low key mood of the hotel and the serene location
likes.disliked: — The mushy apple picked up upon check in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was nice - somewhat dated, though comfortable and offered a very nice bed. Housekeeping service was efficient and thorough during my stay. If you sign up for an Omni guest program, internet in the room is free (vs $9.95/day), though it is slower at times.
reviews.title: Excellent in all respects

reviews.text: Recently spent a long weekend at the Houston Omni. It is a beautiful hotel, and I loved the facilities and setting. The service was excellent - everyone treated us with a smile. This is a quality, well-built hotel. As other reviewers said, the parking is not the best, but it is tolerable -if it is busy and you want to self-park, you may have to walk a good distance to the hotel. Beautiful pool area and lobby - if you like elegance, this one has it.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: I made a last-minute booking (for work) on Hotwire for two nights (a Thursday and a Friday) in Houston, in the Galleria area. Knowing that their "Rodeo" celebration was going on, and thusly expecting there to be little or no availability, I was pleasantly surprised to see that my inquiry returned a reservation at the Omni, easy access to 610. Upon arrival late Thursday evening, I was able to park in the garage near the entrance to the hotel, although there were only a few spaces left at that time. There is another garage available on the back side of the hotel, accessible by walking through the pool area. I actually enjoyed this walk on the two occasions that I had to park in the secondary garage - its well lit and I'm always up for a nice walk.
reviews.title: Great stay, great customer service, great price

likes.liked: — great amenities, great customer service, clean and very well appointed accomodations
likes.disliked: — If you don't know where the hotel is, it's easy to miss it !

reviews.title: Beautiful Upscale Hotel with Great Service
reviews.text: I checked in at the front desk with "Chris" , who was very courteous and personable. Clearly, this is an employee who enjoys his position (or at least he did on that evening, lol !). The lobby is nicely appointed, and there are several restaurants, a small gift shop, and a delightful pub.

reviews.title: Very Nice Stay
reviews.text: I was assigned room 409, quite near the elevator. My room was more than adequate - very clean, two very comfortable queen beds, a television on a "movable" pedestal situated within the armoire, full mini bar, great bathroom toiletries, bathrobes, a great shower, and a great wi-fi internet connection. Several complimentary extras are available if you are a member of the Omni guest program. More than enough pillows on the bed, and for once, a thermostat that was amenable to doing my bidding ! I placed room service orders twice, and each time was great - the prices are what you'd expect for room service (it was after 11:30 pm, and I didn't feel like driving around, searching for a late night meal !).

Housekeeping was great, they checked in on me on Thursday evening, and of course, both mornings. On Saturday, I was completing some work in my room before heading to the airport, and Marya didn't even blink when I was still in the room at noon - she told me to take my time, that she would make mine the last room she did . . . She definitely deserved the extra tip that I left.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Omni

likes.liked: — Comfortable, clean accommodations, close to shopping

reviews.title: 1 night stay - Very Nice hotel But concierge lied.
reviews.text: We stayed 1 night - got in at 8 pm and left at 8 am. I had an overall very good experience - EXCEPT - I asked the concierge if there were any dining establishments nearby and he said no -- that the only 1 was their restaurant- which was empty. The hotel is tucked away in an office park or something and is not on a street with other businesses or shops - NOT CONVENIENT - so you really cannot see anything, especially if you arrive at night. The hotel, I learned the next day, has a free shuttle- limo service - that could have taken us to dinner - the Galleria was right behind us - BUT THE CONCIERGE LIED. We had room service which was very good but - and there are no vending machines - you have to pay mini-bar prices. I guess you need to do your homework. In reading some of the other reviews - service may be Iffy. Other then the concierge - I thought the room was nice and they gave us the room we wanted - 2 beds - non-smoking. Good price from Priceline.

This hotel was in a great location. Very close to the Galleria and Memorial areas. The rooms were very well kept and maintained the bathroom was spotless, and all of the necessary amenities were provided. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. The internet access was a little odd, as the login screen kept interupting my session, however. I never had that happen ANYWHERE before.
reviews.title: I liked this hotel

reviews.text: The service was very good, especially, in the restaurant and the bell service.
reviews.title: The Omni was great
Not my definition of Luxury
reviews.text: The grounds were very nice, and the pool looked nice (though I did not use it) and clean.
I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Stay in Years - start to finish.

reviews.text: My family of four stayed here while visiting relatives. Priceline selected it for us. We stayed 6 nights.
reviews.title: A great place to stay over the holidays

likes.disliked: — The beds were a bit small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lobby is beautiful. We did not partake of the restaurant or lounge. The hotel gift shop was well stocked.
reviews.title: An Even Better Deal with new Addition

likes.disliked: — Service elevator noise adjacent to room

reviews.text: Housekeeping and the bellstaff were attentive to my needs and very helpful. I left an item there and they mailed it to me after my stay. They also brought up a razor for me and helped create a pallet on the floor for my youngest child.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: The beds are FULL-SIZED beds. Not queen or king. My family found it difficult for two people to sleep in them as a result.
reviews.title: Take Advantage of Car Service
Much Better
reviews.text: A professional football team stayed while we were there one night and fans packed the lobby and the players were a bit rowdy during the evening and prior to their departure at 9 a.m. That was distracting.

reviews.title: Nice location, staff..but a bit dated.
reviews.text: At first when i got to the hotel I was a bit dissapointed by the room. It was bit dated with old school wall paper, bathroom tub, tv, etc. I guess i'm just used to hotels having flat screens and modern fixtures. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. What won me over was the staff at the hotel. They were very friendly and courteous. The valet was very effiicient. The pool area is really cool. They had a dj outside spinning music until 6pm with a bar...my type fo setup! The hotel is kind off by itself in the galleria area. I asked the front desk about renovations and she said it was in progress...so this hotel should be the bomb when they finish!

Stayed 4 nights at the Omni off Woodway drive. The hotel is very dated, in fact it doesn't look like the hotel has had improvements since the '80's. Hallways are dark, elevators have old Four Seasons Logo, carpets in rooms are worn and stained, bathrooms are old style. We booked through Travelocity "Good Buys" so we did not pay rack rate, but even so our first room was really bad. Carpet had very bad stains as did upholstered furniture. We would not have minded because we were not in the room very much, however the first night we kept hearing a motor turning off and on all night, which did not allow us to sleep. At first we thought it was the a/c, but then we figured out it was the ice maker across the hall. We asked to be moved the following morning. The second room was cleaner and quiet. The staff was nice, and I guess with the economy the way it is there probably won't be any plans for renovation anytime soon. It is just a shame because the Omni/Four Seasons off Woodway used to be one of the top hotels in Houston. There are far nicer hotels in Houston, so I wold not recommend nor stay here again. The staff was nice, but the place is worn down.
reviews.title: Hotel is in serious need of update

reviews.text: Elegant, lovely room. I truly enjoyed this tremendous hotel. Please dont go here, i wanna keep it a secret for my dam self!
reviews.title: Oh good lord, this was fab and made me sooo happy!

reviews.text: Attentive, helpful, and courteous staff, Clean room (not easy to control temp), very comfortable beds & bedding. Free self parking steps from the hotel. Very prompt and courteous valets that recognize the guests.
reviews.title: Fine example of Southern Hospitality

likes.liked: — Courtesy and efficiency of the personell
likes.disliked: — hard to regulate our room temperature

reviews.text: No glitches with reservation, bellman took care of luggage for multiple rooms without confusion. Room rates were reasonable.
reviews.title: Short Stay for Business

likes.liked: — Location to the best what Houston has to offer.

reviews.title: Great Houston Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here during Hurricane Katrina. I drove all the way to Houston to evacuate from the storm. One of the few available hotels was this one, and I thought it would be worth giving it a shot. Everyone was friendly and helpful, and they really did what it takes to make all of us feel comfortable. Most of the hotel occupants at the time were also Katrina evacuees.

All of the staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, housekeeping was reliable, and there is an excellent swimming pool. The food was also excellent. The only problem was the parking garage. The automatic gate often doesn't work, and you have to go search for someone to open it while everyone lines up behind you.
reviews.title: Could be better, suffers from neglect
Excellent business hotel
reviews.text: Overall, the Omini Hotel was one of the best I have stayed at. I would reccommend this to anyone.

The Omni Houston reports itself as a 5 star hotel. My recent stay here proves other wise. This use to be a Four Seasons hotel and it seems when Omni took over it rested on the Four Seasons name and did not put any effort in upgrading the rooms or lobby area. Parking at this hotel is free for self parking but very hard to figure out where the free parking is because it is shared with office buildings around the hotel. One you do fine it, you must tell the attendant in the booth you’re a hotel guest and then get your ticket stamped at front desk. And the walk to the lobby is far as stated in other reviews; you must drag your luggage through pool area, very, strange. The staff is pleasant enough and seemed professional and efficient in their duties. The rooms are somewhat dated. The furniture looks like it was left over from sometimes in the 80s. Very small TV the rooms were clean however. Heated pool area very nice, but not private as many high rise office buildings in the area tower over the pool. Breakfast in the morning at Omni restaurant was a fiasco. The station where they make omelets backed up 15 people deep. They needed to open another station as one person cooking the omelets is not enough. The rest of the buffet food is in what suppose to be a few set up warmers was ice cold, the trays they were in did not heat the food at all. Service was a bit of a problem as well, not once were we asked for our drink order and had to seat ourselves as we walked in, not knowing if we should or not since no one was up front. The bottom line is, decent hotel, but no where near a 5* the claim to be, I would say more in the lines of a 3* the other Omni hotel in Houston, the Omni Westside just underwent renovations and is wonderful place to stay. Unfortunately the hotel Omni Houston needs the same renovations to be able to compete and demand the prices they charge.
reviews.title: Omni Experience with Hurrican Rita
Reservation not honored
reviews.text: Reading these reviews, I was very concerned about my Mon-Fri stay. But this is a solid four star hotel. My very quiet room was large, had a great view, and had a fine desk, chair, armoire, blackout curtains, and a king size bed in great shape. Lots of nice touches, like two terrycloth robes, about 10 towels of various sizes, a CD clock radio, a retractable clothesline in the shower, and a full size ironing board and an iron with a long cord. Staff were very respectful and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Omni is a old favorite of mine in Houston and this past weekend was our first time back in a couple of years. The location is one of the best in Houston for access to shopping, dining, major interstates and even downtown. It's tucked between a small forest and some office buildings and a new high rise condo but there's very little activity on the weekend from the offices. I would even say the setting is serene for a large city hotel. The grounds are immaculate with a cool swan pond in front of the property. Two restaurants and a great bar, The Black Swan.
reviews.title: Great location, good service...rooms need makeover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service this weekend was friendly, prompt and overall above average, especially at check in. I had requested and they accomidated, without my asking again at check in, a corner room overlooking the pool and pond. These rooms are a bit larger and at end of the hall, far from the elevators and service areas. However, the rooms are in desparate need of an aesthetic makeover, especially in the bathroom. Paint and wallpaper in poor condition, bathroom fixtures are loose and turn all the way around. The bathroom marble is not in the best condition and they need new shower curtains. On the other hand, the carpet was in good shape and the bed was very comfortable, but I'm surprised the sheets were not of a better quality. I hope they get new TV's when they remodel to catch up with the competition.
reviews.title: I rate this hotel five stars

likes.liked: — The way the staff treated me and my wife ..... Friendly
likes.disliked: — We had to leave .. checkout time

reviews.title: Got kids?
reviews.text: Finally, our very fair rate included the buffet breakfast for two in the Cafe. The food was great, especially the fresh berries. The service was good, but not exactly friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm checking four stars, but it's really a 3 1/2, at least until the rooms are remodeled.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here April 12 & 13th 208. We were having a romantic getaway for the weekend. The hotel staff treated us like KING & QUEEN. This place is beautiful. The place is spotless. I am a clean freak too. Staff always greeted meby Mr. Brown. It's a warm feeling.
reviews.title: Needs help!

reviews.text: Rating: 4.5 stars
reviews.title: Excellent Service and Value, needs maintenance
5th Anniversary overnight
reviews.text: Pros: Value, Service, bathroom counter space, free parking option.
Cons: Can see the age of the hotel, noisy on weekends, good breakfast
reviews.title: Houston Omni

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2014, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here Jan 4, 2014 as a member of a wedding block. They let me check in around 11 AM and we got late check out the next day at 1 PM. Check-in was a breeze as the desk staff already had our room ready. Valet and front desk were both very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Houston Staycation

reviews.text: We had a king room on the third floor. This caused issues as there's a popular nightclub in the basement of the Omni on the weekends called the Black Swan. I could clearly hear the music from the club at 1 AM. I was not bothered by this but some guests would be put off by it.
reviews.title: Stay at Omni Post Oak

description: Discover a luxurious oasis at the Omni Houston Hotel. Situated on impeccably manicured grounds, the Houston Galleria hotel features the finest in Houston accommodations with 378 spacious guest rooms, including 33 luxury suites, all with sensational views of the city or pool area. Enjoy the nightlife at Black Swan. The Omni Houston Hotel is centrally located in the prestigious Uptown Post Oak/Galleria area and is just minutes from all of the excitement that Houston, Texas has to offer. You are just 10 minutes by car from the central business district and 30 minutes from George Bush Intercontinental Airport or 25 minutes from William P. Hobby Airport. Of course, our exceptional amenities and four-diamond service may make it hard to leave your room.
